questions.question: Synchronous motors are usually supplied by:
options: a. three phase AC
b. single phase AC
c. DC to the stator
d. DC to the stator and AC to the rotor

questions.question: Reversing two phases to a three phase motor will:
options: a. blow the phase fuses
b. cause the motor to run in reverse
c. overheat the stator windings
d. stall the motor

questions.question: A synchronous motor runs at a speed that depends upon the supply:
options: a. voltage
b. current
c. reactance
d. frequency

questions.question: If one phase of the supply to a three phase motor fails, then:
options: a. the motor will continue to run at the same speed
b. will slow down and stop
c. will stop immediately
d. will run at about half speed but will not start on its next selection

questions.question: The basic principle of operation of a 3 phase induction motor is:
options: a. a rotating field created in the rotor
b. a rotating field created in the stator
c. a stationary field created in the stator
d. a stationary field created in the rotor

questions.question: In an induction motor:
options: a. the rotor is star connected
b. magnetic fields blend evenly with one another
c. AC is induced in the rotor
d. a DC supply produces DC in the rotor

questions.question: In a synchronous motor, the rotor is:
options: a. energized by DC and it lines up with the magnetic field in the stator
b. wave wound
c. both AC and DC energized
d. impeded by the AC induced into it

questions.question: An induction motor has:
options: a. slip rings and brushes
b. a commutator
c. no slip ring or brushes
d. slip rings but no brushes

questions.question: A squirrel cage rotor:
options: a. is not connected to the supply
b. is expensive to produce
c. rotates at exactly synchronous speed
d. is a closed circuit of high resistance

questions.question: A starting circuit for a powerful single phase induction motor might be:
options: a. a capacitance starter
b. a resistance / inductance starter
c. a cartridge starter
d. a bump starter
